final_answer.precision_note: Result given to 3 significant figures, consistent with the bond energy values provided (all to 3 sig figs). Negative sign indicates exothermic reaction.

method: Using bond energy calculations: Bonds broken in reactants (endothermic): 4×C-H bonds in CH4 = 4×413 = 1652 kJ mol-1, plus 2×O=O bonds in 2O2 = 2×498 = 996 kJ mol-1. Total bonds broken = 2648 kJ mol-1. Bonds formed in products (exothermic): 2×C=O bonds in CO2 = 2×805 = 1610 kJ mol-1, plus 4×O-H bonds in 2H2O = 4×463 = 1852 kJ mol-1. Total bonds formed = 3462 kJ mol-1. deltaH = bonds broken - bonds formed = 2648 - 3462 = -814 kJ mol-1.
checks: Energy balance check: Bonds broken (2648 kJ) minus bonds formed (3462 kJ) gives -814 kJ mol-1, correctly showing exothermic combustion.
